word_mean: 轰击：将全身或特定组织靶暴露于电离辐射的作用之下

sentence.Network_en: He agreed on condition that I bombard the enemy house.
sentence.Network_cn: 他同意了,条件是我去轰炸敌人的房子.

sentence.Network_en: The molecules of air would bombard all sides and both ends of the cylinder.
sentence.Network_cn: 空气的分子会撞击圆筒的整个筒壁和上下两端.

sentence.Network_en: But when these words are extended into longer, the silent letters become audible: hymnal, condemnation and bombard.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是当这些单词扩展为一个长的单词后.不发音的部分变为发音: hymnal,condemnation, bombard. 这是一般规则.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (as a noun denoting an early form of cannon, also a shawm) from Old French bombarde, probably based on Latin bombus 'booming, humming' (see bomb). The verb (late 16th cent.)is from French bombarder

entry.tran: 连珠炮似的质问（或批评）；使大量面对
entry.def: If you bombard someone with something, you make them face a great deal of it. For example, if you bombard them with questions or criticism, you keep asking them a lot of questions or you keep criticizing them.

example.ex: He bombarded Catherine with questions to which he should have known the answers...
example.tran: 他明知故问地不断质问凯瑟琳。

example.ex: The media bombards all of us with images of violence and drugs and sex...
example.tran: 媒体上关于暴力、毒品和性的画面充斥着我们的视线。

entry.tran: （用炮火或炸弹）猛烈轰击（或攻击）
entry.def: When soldiers bombard a place, they attack it with continuous heavy gunfire or bombs.

example.ex: Rebel artillery units have regularly bombarded the airport...
example.tran: 叛军的炮兵部队经常轰炸机场。

example.ex: The town has been heavily bombarded by the army backed by the airforce.
example.tran: 该镇遭到了有空军掩护的陆军部队的猛烈攻击。

means.word_mean: 1. a large shawm; the bass member of the shawm family
1. cast, hurl, or throw repeatedly with some missile;
2. throw bombs at or attack with bombs;
